Job Posting:172501 - Position: W26 Data Analyst Intern/Co-op 172501 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/27/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 09/03/2025 11:31 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country TD Bank Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Data Analyst Intern/Co-op 172501 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 37.5 Major List $45, 700 - $74, 400 CAD Data Analyst Intern/Co-op (WINTER 2026) End Date: September 27, 2025 R_1434772 Pay Details: $45, 700 - $74, 400 CAD TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs. As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role. Job Description: DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care. Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features: • Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization • Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more • JOB DESCRIPTION You will have the opportunity to work with one of our various teams within the (Data-as-a-service or DaaS). From Day 1, you will be treated as an equal member of the team and given meaningful assignments to help us deliver improvements to our data platforms across multiple segments such as Core Banking, Business Banking, Insurance, Wealth, or Enterprise Platforms. Job responsibilities for a junior Data Analyst may vary by area. This may include, but is not limited to the following: • Work with business and technology partners to define, develop and document detailed business, data and system requirements. • Participate as a member of agile pod team focused on developing new capabilities, including agile ceremonies. • Collaborate with data engineers, product owners, quality engineers and other stakeholders to deliver an end-to-end capability from concept to production-deployment. • Have performed data analysis, profiling, clean-up, data wrangling and validation as part of University assignments. • Based on data analysis, provide recommendations for data remediation, improvements. • Participate in program/ system research, analysis, detailed design and problem resolution. • Respond to user enquiries on data platform, in a timely manner. • Troubleshoot and determine root cause and resolution for application defects. • Apply Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Methodology (PMLC) to complete specific tasks for projects. • Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep up-to-date with leading-edge technologies trends/developments. • Develop expertise in data platform, infrastructure, data pipeline, analytical tools and design techniques that can contribute to effective solution development and delivery. • Good communication, interpersonal, collaboration skills to work in an agile cross-functional team, with different stakeholders. • Have owned, delivered a project assignment in University starting from Inception, Initiation, Execution until Implementation. Project outcome reviewed and measured as expected. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided. Additionally, we are open to all years of study but primarily target 3rd & 4th year students. Early Talent Requirements • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence January 5th - April 24th, 2026. • Applications must include a resume (maximum of 2 pages). • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest. • TD requires employees to reside in Canada where the role is located. Successful candidates are expected to arrange relocation to one of our Toronto offices in a hybrid model (4 days per week in office). Assigned Line of Business Requirements Please note that the line of business that you are assigned to may require specific skills not mentioned in this posting Job Requirements JOB REQUIREMENTS • Currently enrolled in a relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc. • Strong communication and inter-personal skills with the ability to deliver message and ideas effectively to diverse audiences such as business, development, quality engineers and management stakeholders. • A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology such as Azure, python, Talend, Tableau, Informatica. • Familiarity with Jira and Confluence. • Proficient with Excel, Visio, SQL, some reporting and analytical tools. • Understands Data Modeling concepts. • Able to manage multiple priorities and work independently, as well as part of a team. • Experience with technology project delivery and agile delivery methodology would be an asset. • Some prior experience with creating visualization such as Process and Data Flows. • Good documentation skill; can produce data mapping between Source and Target Systems. Capture User Stories and Use Cases. • Hands-on programming experience would be an asset, which could include familiarity and strength in any of the following: C, C++, C#, Object C, Java, Java Script, Python, NodeJS, SQL, J2EE, Web Services, DB2, MS SQL. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
